title: Ericsson's sustainable waste management business venture - Sustainability Magazine
summary: Ericsson's Connected Recycling (ECR) is a digitalized, end-to-end solution that connects the reverse supply chain to reduce waste in landfills. ECR empowers retailers to comply with regulations, generate new revenue streams, and strive to reach zero waste. The platform has demonstrated a 40% reduction in waste volumes for a major retailer and the inclusion of three materials into circular material flows.
green_innovation: TRUE. ECR contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing waste in landfills, conserving natural resources, and promoting reuse and recycling.
business_innovation: TRUE. ECR is a new and improved business process for waste management that differs significantly from previous methods. It utilizes digitalization and connectivity to enhance efficiency, transparency, and traceability in the recycling supply chain.
green_product: TRUE. ECR enables the transformation of waste materials into new products, promoting a circular economy and reducing the need for virgin materials.
green_process: TRUE. ECR is a green process that minimizes environmental impacts by reducing waste, conserving resources, and promoting sustainable practices in the recycling industry.

title: Waste is a design flaw: How ReBorn is turning plastic waste into homewares | Virgin - Virgin
summary: ReBorn is a start-up that is transforming the homeware industry by turning industrial waste into functional and design-led products. ReBorn's products are made from 100% recycled plastic and are fully recyclable, reusable, and repairable. ReBorn has partnered with Biffa, the UK's leading sustainable waste management company, to source the plastic waste and make the products in the UK.

title: Malakoff Geared To Support Malaysia's Environmental Goals - BusinessToday
summary: Malakoff Corporation Berhad (Malakoff) is playing a pivotal role in reducing waste and greenhouse gas emissions through its waste management solutions. The company has implemented various programs to increase recycling capacity, such as Fasiliti Inovasi Kitar Semula (FIKS) in Putrajaya and Recovery Initiative Sustainable Eco-Facility (RISE Kuala Lumpur). Malakoff is also exploring Waste-to-Energy (WTE) technology to further minimize waste and emissions.
